Posts.Title: waiting, waiting, and more waiting Emily2008 yellowrose

Posts.Content: Jun 1, 2008 07:10AM Donna2783 wrote: Sue, I'm 58 years old, semi retired and am married 37 years.  My sister has flown down to be with me for the next ten days.   I found my lump during a self exam, I was due for my yearly mamogram almost exactly the same time.  I think it was a big lump....1.5 cm.  I had a mamogram, and ultrasound the same day with a category five lump classification.  Surgeon was referred to me by my Internist and verified by my gyn.  I had a lumpectomy about two days later.  They checked the lymph node and he said that it was there too.  I go tomorrow for a review of the path. report.  I don't know if they want to go for more lymp nodes.  I am just a mess.  Like Emily, I'm trying to stay busy but I slip into these moods that are very bad...loosing weight, can't eat.  Can't tell my friends, can't look at healthy people. Can't move from being a victim to a survivor.  I have a JP drain which is doing fine and two incisions...with this tape on them the stitches are on the inside.  The surgeon said the lump margins looked good he removed tissue about the size of a golf balls.  I just hang on evey word.  I like him but he didn't tell me about needing this drain.
Posts.Title: waiting, waiting, and more waiting Emily2008 yellowrose

Posts.Content: May 31, 2008 03:27AM Donna2783 wrote: I am a newly freaked out women too.  I discovered a lump and went to the dr.  Had a mammogram and ultrasound the same day    (Friday)and also scheduled an appt with a surgeon 5 days later.   My OBGYN got the report Friday afternoon and called to see me on Monday.  When I told her I was to see surgeonon Wed.  She called his office and he saw me that same day.  Tues I had the lump removed.  I just wanted it out.  It came back as cancer.  I had another procedure checking the Sentential lymph node..that was positive too.  Now Monday June 2  I get have an appt. to review the pathology reports.  I am so upset, I can't eat, sleep, the doctors gave me xanax because I cry and get anxiety attacks.  I've never been sick a day in my life.  Im the caretaker in my family,  I'm 58.  I found this website in a group of materials the surgeon gave me, hoping to find someone to talk to.  I am so scared.  So when I saw this conversation thread  newly freaked out, I though.....this sounds like me.
Posts.Title: newly freaked out anniemcelfresh Dukemom2

Posts.Content: May 31, 2008 03:33AM Donna2783 wrote: I'm waiting and a wreck.  I see my surgeon Mon am it will be my first appt. to review pathology test results.  I know I have to prepare my questions but I'm so upset I can't think.  All I want to do is cry and take xanax.  My mind is taking me to some very bad places.  How do you hang on?  I have never been sick in my life.
Posts.Title: waiting, waiting, and more waiting Emily2008 yellowrose

Posts.Content: Jun 1, 2008 07:11AM Donna2783 wrote: Thank you for answering my message.
Posts.Title: waiting, waiting, and more waiting Emily2008 yellowrose
